data.title: TORM declares $0.70 dividend
data.description:
• TORM (TRMD) declares $0.70/share interim dividend.
  • Payable March 25; for shareholders of record March 12; ex-div March 12.
  • The distribution for the quarter is equivalent to 82% of net profit and reflects the Distribution Policy.
  • The payment date is 25 March 2026 to all shareholders on record as of 12 March 2026, and the ex-dividend date is 11 March 2026 for the shares listed on Nasdaq OMX Copenhagen and 12 March 2026 for the shares listed on Nasdaq New York.
  • See TRMD Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Nasdaq, S&P 500, Dow mixed as traders digest Nvidia results
data.description:
The stock market opened mixed on Thursday as investors were left underwhelmed by Nvidia’s (NVDA) fourth-quarter results and guidance.

The S&P 500 (SP500) -0.1%, the Dow (DJI) +0.4%, and the Nasdaq Composite (COMP:IND) -0.2%.

Nvidia was down 2% after the semiconductor giant reported fiscal fourth-quarter results and guidance that topped Wall Street’s forecasts by a wide margin. 

On the economic calendar, investors awaited the Kansas City Fed manufacturing index and the Fed balance sheet.

Initial jobless claims rose less than expected in the past week.

Treasury yields were mixed. The shorter-end U.S. 2-year Treasury yield (US2Y) fell to 3.48%. The benchmark U.S. 10-year Treasury yield (US10Y) moved up to 4.06%, while the U.S. 30-year Treasury yield (US30Y) declined to 4.70%.

data.title: Flowco Holdings reports Q4 results
data.description:
• Flowco Holdings press release (FLOC): Q4 Revenue of $197.2M.
  • Adjusted EBITDA1 of $83.5 million
  • Adjusted EBITDA Margin1 of 42.4%
  • Net cash provided by operating activities of $87.2 million and Free Cash Flow1 of $63.2 million
  • In January 2026, Flowco's Board of Directors declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.08 per share
  • Robust liquidity with approximately $579.6 million of availability under our revolving credit facility as of February 20, 2026

data.title: Lowest Quant ranked large-cap stocks with positive EPS surprises
data.description:
With the Q4 earnings season almost coming to an end, below is a list of large cap stocks with positive quarterly EPS surprises ranked according to the lowest Seeking Alpha Quant Ratings.

The list is topped by Crown Castle Inc. (CCI), with a Quant Rating of 1.08. Gartner, Inc. (IT) and Nutanix, Inc. (NTNX) follow closely behind, with BXP, Inc. (BXP) and GoDaddy Inc. (GDDY) rounding out the top five. While these companies exceeded earnings expectations with positive EPS surprises, their overall quantitative profiles remain bearish according to the screening metrics.

For reference, Seeking Alpha’s Quant system ranks stocks based on their performance on certain critical quantitative measures, such as valuation, growth, stock momentum, and profitability. Each stock is rated on a scale of 1 to 5, with any rating above 3.5 indicating a bullish rating. A score of 2.5 or below represents a bearish profile.

Here is the list:

  1. Crown Castle (CCI), Quant Rating: 1.08

  2. Gartner (IT), Quant Rating: 1.18

  3. Nutanix (NTNX), Quant Rating: 1.20

  4. BXP (BXP), Quant Rating: 1.38

  5. GoDaddy (GDDY), Quant Rating: 1.49

  6. Erie Indemnity (ERIE), Quant Rating: 1.50

  7. CDW (CDW), Quant Rating: 1.59

  8. Verisk Analytics (VRSK), Quant Rating: 1.69

  9. First Citizens BancShares (FCNCA), Quant Rating: 2.25

  10. American Financial Group (AFG), Quant Rating: 2.38

data.title: The Chemours Company launches $600M private offering
data.description:
• The Chemours Company (CC) intends to offer $600M aggregate principal amount of new senior notes due 2034.
  • The notes will be senior unsecured obligations of Chemours and will be guaranteed by a subsidiary of Chemours.
  • Chemours intends to use the net proceeds from the offering to fund the redemption of its outstanding 5.375% senior notes due 2027 and to fund the redemption or repurchase of a portion of its outstanding 5.750% senior notes due 2028.
  • CC -0.11% premarket to $18.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Supermicro launches industry’s first high-density MicroBlade platform with AMD EPYC 4005 CPUs
data.description:
• Supermicro (SMCI) launched the industry’s first high-density blade server platform powered by AMD EPYC 4005 series processors.
  • The new MicroBlade platform features a flexible architecture allowing mixed CPU and node configurations within a single enclosure.
  • The system can scale up to 320 server nodes in a standard 48U rack for maximum compute density.
  • The 6U enclosure supports up to 40 nodes, targeting cloud, virtualization, enterprise, edge, data services, and specialized compute workloads.
  • Integrated networking includes dual-port 25GbE with two 25G Ethernet switches and 100G uplinks to reduce cabling and lower total cost of ownership.
  • Advanced management features include TPM 2.0, hardware root of trust, IPMI 2.0, KVM over IP, Redfish API, and full remote chassis management via CMM.
  • CEO Charles Liang said the platform maximizes scalability, energy efficiency, and long-term data center investment protection.
